title: (x) WW2 Fraktur font / Schaftstiefelgrotesk - Tannenberg {Tomi, Jan}
content:
I haven't been able to track down this particular font, any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011100528im_/http:/typophile.com/files/0000010_4060_3807.jpg)
author: Beau002

comments.content:
The name is Tannenberg. The rest is close.

[http://www.delbanco-frakturschriften.de/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011100528/http:/www.delbanco-frakturschriften.de/ "http://www.delbanco-frakturschriften.de/")

Click ‘Gotisch’ and scroll down.

Ah, here we go again – seen here: [http://typophile.com/node/64037](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011100528/http:/typophile.com/node/64037 "http://typophile.com/node/64037")

Tannenberg is close but not quite it.
I stand corrected, was looking at a different version. Looks like Tannenberg schmal, D. Stempel, 1933. Not sure how close the digital versions are.

Check out my FontStruction [Tears In Rain](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011100528/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/fontstructions/show/tears_in_rain) which was partially inspired by Tannenberg.

- Lex
